p: The medicinal taxa recorded belong to 68 families. In this category, Lamiaceae is the most reported with 18.78%, followed by Asteraceae (17.06%) and, far from them, Rutaceae (6.49%). These results are close to those recorded in other ethnofloristic works conducted in Mediterranean areas, where predominating families Asteraceae, Lamiaceae and Rosaceae occupy first places [ 68]. The relevant presence of Rutaceae has its explanation in the specific use of their main species reported, Ruta chalepensis subsp. angustifolia for abortive use (in both animals and humans) and postpartum coadjuvant (in animals) and Dictamnus hispanicus for antihypertensive use.
